measured_by: NASA Task Load Index mental-demand rating
justification: “participants were asked to rate how demanding the preceding choice was ("How mentally demanding was that choice") following the NASA TLX scale (Hart, 2006)”
After each choice participants rated “How confident are you that the choice you made was the best choice?” on a 1–7 scale, following Folke, Jacobsen, Fleming, & De Martino (2016).
“prior to the choice task, participants first completed … the Operation Span task (OSPAN; Unsworth et al., 2005)”
“participants first completed two computerized tasks: the Digit Symbol Coding Task (Mathias et al., 2017) …”
“in Experiment 2, we developed … the Decision Avoidance Task to examine whether individuals … avoid choosing between High-demand risky choice pairs”
“we investigated pupillometric measures of on-line effort exertion … As task-evoked pupillary responses (TEPRs) are believed to index momentary cognitive effort exertion”
“participants responded to three questionnaires … the Need for Cognition Scale (NFC; Cacioppo et al., 1984)”
“participants responded to … the Maximization scale (Nenkov et al., 2008)”
“participants responded to … the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI; Spielberger, 1983)”
